timeline.message: feat(poetry): Created channels to create PoetryDetectable
feat(poetry): Added logic for poetry.lock parser
refactor(pip): Reorganized pip detectables into their own sub-packages
feat(poetry): Added test for poetry detectable
feat(build): Importing tomlj TOML parser
fix(build): Revised placement of org.tomlj dependency
feat(poetry): Edited poetry detectable to use new TOML parser
feat(test): Edited PoetryDetectableTest to test parsing of package.dependencies
fix: Replaced org.antlr.v4.runtime.misc.Nullable imports since no longer resolved by Detect
style: Added copyright tag to new files
fix: Removed unnecessary model class
feat(poetry): Added unit test for PoetryLockParser
feat(poetry): Poetry detectable now parses a String instead of an InputStream
fix: Replaced org.springframework.lang.Nullable annotations with org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable annotations
refactor: Undo reorganization of pip detectable classes
feat(doc): Added release note for Poetry support
feat(doc): Updated package manager documentation to detail support for Poetry
refactor: Revert to org.antlr.misc.Nullable imports (will be changed on a different branch)
refactor: Revert to org.antlr.misc.Nullable imports (will be changed on a different branch)
fix: Deleted unnecessary PoetryResolver
fix(docs): Removed ticket number from poetry support feature

JakeMathews

timeline.bodyText:
Poetry uses unique files to queue off of. Since this is a python project, is there a change the other Python detectors are triggered to extract as well such as a requirements.txt?
Does it make sense to yield the other python detectors to poetry?
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText:
"Does it make sense to yield the other python detectors to poetry?"


That's a good question.  Not really sure, to be honest, but I feel like if a pyproject.toml file is found then the project should be treated exclusively as a poetry project, as no other package managers would have that file
replies.author: crowleySynopsys
